data.title: Kylie Lough - Women's Lightweight Rowing

Kylie Lough - AWARDS


	IRA Lightweight Double National Champion (2024)

data.text:
Kylie Lough

Kylie Lough

Class:

Sophomore

Hometown:

North Andover, Mass.

Height:

5-7

High School:

Phillips Academy

Summary

Media

Historical

Summary

Biography

AWARDS

IRA Lightweight Double National Champion (2024)

Eastern Sprints Champion (2024)

HOCR Women’s Championship 2x Bronze Medalist (2023)

AS A SOPHOMORE IN 2023-24

Bow seat in the Lightweight Double that won the Grand Final in 7:35.007 and the national title at the IRA National Championship Regatta (June 1-2), becoming the fourth BU crew to earn gold in the entry … Earned bronze in the Women’s Championship Doubles, becoming the first Terrier crew in program history to medal in the event, at the 58th Head of the Charles Regatta (Oct. 21) … Bow seat in the Second Varsity 8 that defeated MIT and Wellesley (March 30) … Bow seat in the Second Varsity 8 that toppled Boston College and Bates (April 7) … Bow seat in BU’s “A” Double that won its heat while posting the fastest time of any Doubles crew (7:45.41) at the Knecht Cup (April 14) … Bow seat in BU’s “A” Double that beat Harvard-Radcliffe (April 20) … Bow seat in BU’s “A” Double that defeated Princeton at the Eastern Sprints (May 5) to help BU capture the Konrad Ulbrich Team Trophy … Bow seat in the Double that defeated Stanford at Redwood Shores (May 12) … Bow seat in the Championship Lightweight Double that competed in the Henley Women’s Regatta (June 21-23), advancing to the quarterfinal round of the Haslam Trophy bracket.

AS A FRESHMAN IN 2022-23

Bow seat in the 3V/Novice 8 that placed second in the spring opener against Boston College (March 25) … Bow seat in the 2x “B” crew that placed second against Harvard-Radcliffe (April 8) … Bow seat in the Lightweight 2x “B” crew that earned silver and bow seat in the Second Varsity 4 that also finished runner-up at the Knecht Cup (April 15-16) … Bow seat in the Lightweight 2x “B” crew that beat Wisconsin and Gordon in a time of 7:45.310 at the Eastern Sprints (April 30) … Bow seat in the Collegiate 2x that captured gold in the Grand Final with a time of 7:44.215 at the Dad Vail Regatta (May 12-13) … Bronze medalist as the bow seat in the Lightweight Double with a time of 7:50.54 at the IRA National Championship Regatta (June 3-4).

BEFORE BOSTON UNIVERSITY

Rowed for the Cambridge Boat Club program ... Bow seat in the Junior 2x that finished fifth in the 2021 Head of the Charles ... Earned third in the Women's 2x at the USRowing Northeast Youth Championships as a senior ... Captured first in the Women's 4x at the Northeast Youth Championships as a junior ... Also earned top-five results in the U23 Lightweight 2x (bow seat - first place), U19 4x (bow seat - third place excluding U.S. Selection Camp boats), U19 8+ (bow seat - third place excluding U.S. Selection Camp boats), U23 8+ (bow seat - fourth place), U23 Lightweight 1x (fifth place) ... Earned 10th place in the Women's Junior 1x at the 2019 Head of the Charles ... Captured first place in the Women's U17 1x and was first overall in all Female Divisions at the Head of the Quinobequin as a sophomore ... Stroke seat in the Phillips Academy Women's 2V8+ boat that finished fifth at the New England Interscholastic Rowing Association regatta as a freshman ... Also competed in gymnastics, tennis, basketball, and swimming.

PERSONAL

Daughter of Amanda and Tom Lough ... Enrolled in the College of Engineering to major in Mechanical Engineering at BU.
